Name: Coin of Ptolemy the Second and Arsinoe the Second
Description: The gold octodrachm was minted in Alexandria during the reign of Ptolemy the Second (Philadelphus) or Ptolemy the Third. On the reverse, Ptolemy the Second and Arsinoe the Second are depicted with their busts facing toward the right.Ptolemy is wearing a chlamys, or a short oblong mantle, and a diadem, a type of crown, while Arsinoe is veiled and wears a diadem.In the field to the left, an oval Gaulish shield is depicted, and above them the Greek inscription "Adelphon" reads "brothers." On the obverse, Ptolemy the First and Berenice the First are depicted. Their busts face toward the right. Both of them are wearing diadems and Berenice is veiled. On top, there is a Greek inscription that reads "Theon," or "gods."
